text: Good day everyone. My name is Selamot Umar Arto and I'm part of the team behind PAD by
LOD, an AI-powered visual navigation system designed to empower visually impaired individuals
with independence, safety and dignity. Visual impairment isn't just a health issue, it's
a barrier to education, independence and dignity. According to the World Health Organization,
over 2.2 billion people live with visual impairment and 1 billion luck access to basic
solutions like glasses or surgery. In Nigeria alone, there are approximately 1.5 million
visually impaired individuals, many of whom struggle daily with tucks as simple as not
getting safely. Many individuals rely on others for help which
limit their independence and exposes them to rigs like accident or get ill loss. And
it's not just about mobility, it's about dignity. Limited access to affordable and effective
navigation, it leaves millions feeling excluded from society.
In Nigeria, red are often poorly designed, sidewalks are uneven and public spaces rarely
consider accessibility. For example, think about university campuses when nearly 30%
of students with disabilities face significant challenges navigating through lecture halls,
libraries and hostels. They depend heavily on friends, family or strangers to get them
and when no one is available, the rigs get ill loss or injured along the road. This is
a problem we determined to solve. Our solution path pilots and AI powered visual
navigation system, the orchas in a new era of independence for visually impaired individuals.
Our solution is this advanced AI technology. Our system detect obstacles, recognize environment
and guide users via audio cues and haptic feedback. The hardware includes a smartphone,
Arduino Nano, helmet and belt, but the software integrate tools like flutter, bubble map, object
detection and path planning models. Users receive little time obstacle detection and
step-by-step navigation instructions to voice guidance and vibration. A system that is not
only cost effective but also intuitive and life changing.
Path payload addresses the challenges faced by visually impaired individuals and several
ways. It provides a little time obstacle detection which ensures users avoid hazard
like uneven surfaces, pose or vehicles. Voice guided navigation helps them reach their destination
safely and independently and lastly haptic feedback which provides static alert for added
awareness. Most importantly our solution is affordable, making it accessible to those
who need it the most. Student at universities can now move between classes, libraries and
boosters without relying on others. Working professionals can commit safely to their jobs.

To ensure path payloads which is as many possible people as possible, we've developed a sustainable
